intro: Babiana disticha, commonly known as the rain lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Iridaceae family, which includes irises and gladiolus. The plant produces striking, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red, with a yellow throat, and blooms in late summer to early autumn. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often growing in rocky or gravelly habitats. Babiana disticha is also cultivated for its ornamental value and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
